description: In Friday, 26th March 2021, Mauritania Begins its national Vaccination Campaign. According to the country's state news agency, Nouakchott's (Capital city of Mauritania) medical staff will get the jabs first, followed by medical staff in all other cities and people with chronic diseases and vulnerable groups.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_group: Certain populations based on demographic characteristics/epidemiological risk given preference for vaccinations
type_vac_who_pays: No information provided on how much vaccine cost to the individual
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Priority Group 1: Essential medical workers,People with certain health conditions,Other population

description: In Friday, 26th March 2021, the government of Mauritania announced its national vaccination campaign after having receive Covid vaccines from China. description: Travelers required to present negative Covid-19 test taken up to 5 days before arrival, complete health declaration, submit to temperature check.. Travelers to Mauritania must present evidence of a negative COVID-19 polymerase chain reaction  PCR  test, dated up to five days before arrival. Previous requirement was that the test be taken up to 72 hours before arrival.  change first noted on update Dec 13th  Visitors must wear a face-mask and complete an individual health declaration upon arrival. Visitors will undergo a contactless temperature check on arrival and must agree to a PCR or rapid antigen test if a temperature is detected. While waiting for the test result visitors must self-isolate at place of residence, a government-approved hotel or quarantine centre.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On March 23 the Mauritanian city of Aleg initiated a campaign to improve sanitization efforts in the city by distributing "dozens of water drums
equipped with faucets and quantities of hygiene and sterilization
materials such as soap, javel and medical masks in the markets, points
of sale of fish, meat and vegetables, health centers and other service
facilities in addition to the places where cars gather and at the
entrances to the city of Aleg".

description: In Mauritania a crisis committee was created called "Covid-19 contamination control committee chaired by whose main task is to coordinate and follow up directives aimed at fight against the Coronavirus starting with the implementation of the following decisions: 1. The creation of a scientific committee, which must set up a training program on hygiene measures and medical care for suspected or confirmed patients.2. The strengthening of the Hospital Hygiene and Nosocomial Infection Control Committee, through a new specific mission to combat COVID-19 contamination.3. The creation of hand washing points from Tuesday, March 17, 2020 at the front door of the Center.4. Reactivation of staff awareness on the importance of hygiene measures and multi-daily cleaning of surfaces.5. The limitation to the strict minimum of patient visits and the number of accompanying persons per patient.6. A 50% reduction in the number of consultations and avoiding crowding of patients in waiting rooms by respecting the distance of one meter between patients.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)
